Visualize Exposure Impact Metrics from DEG Centrality Analysis

Source: R/plot_exposure_impact.R
plot_exposure_impact.Rd

This function generates a two-panel visualization of the results from run_exposure_impact. It displays (1) the degree centrality of features associated with each exposure as a boxplot, and (2) a stacked bar plot summarizing how many differentially expressed features are associated with exposures.

Usage

plot_exposure_impact(
  expomicset,
  feature_type = c("degs", "omics", "factors"),
  min_per_group = 5,
  facet_cols = NULL,
  bar_cols = NULL,
  alpha = 0.3,
  ncol = 2,
  nrow = 1,
  heights = c(1, 1),
  widths = c(2, 1)
)

Arguments

expomicset

A MultiAssayExperiment object containing the output from run_exposure_impact in its metadata.

min_per_group

Integer. Minimum number of features required for an exposure group to be included in the boxplot. Default is 5.

facet_cols

Optional vector of colors for the exposure category facets. If NULL, defaults to ggsci::pal_jco() colors.

bar_cols

Optional vector of colors for the bar plot groups. If NULL, defaults to ggsci::pal_uchicago() colors.

alpha

Numeric between 0 and 1. Transparency of facet background fill. Default is 0.5.

ncol

Integer. Number of columns in the combined patchwork layout. Default is 2.

nrow

Integer. Number of rows in the combined patchwork layout. Default is 1.

heights

Numeric vector. Relative heights of the patchwork panels. Default is c(1, 1).

widths

Numeric vector. Relative widths of the patchwork panels. Default is c(2, 1).

Value

A ggplot object composed with patchwork that includes:

  1. A boxplot of degree centrality values for features associated with each exposure.

  2. A barplot showing the number of DEGs associated and not associated with exposures.

Details

This function assumes that run_exposure_impact has already been run and that the resulting exposure impact metrics are stored in the metadata(expomicset) list under the "exposure_impact" entry.

The left panel (boxplot) stratifies centrality by exposure and facet category. The right panel (barplot) summarizes the total and associated DEG counts.

See also

run_exposure_impact, wrap_plots
